results.title: Blue Hawaii (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Hal Wallis Productions
results.brief_description: Chad Gates (Elvis Presley) returns to Hawaii after leaving the army. On his return he rebels against his rich and domineering mother (Angela Lansbury) and leaves the family pineapple business for a job as a tourist guide. Chad’s tours lead him straight into a tropical squall of trouble with his mother, the law and his girlfriend. Stars: Elvis Presley, Joan Blackman and Angela Lansbury.

results.title: Mona Lisa
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, Patrick Cassavetti, Palace Pictures and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: Bob Hoskins plays a small-time con, just out of prison, who is delivering porn videos for a living. He gets a job as a minder to call-girl, Simone, (Cathy Tyson) and soon finds he is falling in love with her and assisting her to find her friend, Cathy, a young prostitute who has disappeared. A stylish film-noir set in contemporary London, “Mona Lisa” is also a challenging film about honour, responsibility and compassion in a society that is decaying and cruel. Cast also includes Michael Caine and Robbie Coltrane.

results.title: The Big Steal
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan).

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan). A shonky car dealer, Farkas, takes Danny for a ride by selling him a Jaguar with a disaster area where the engine should be. But Danny manages to get his revenge on the sleazy Farkas as well as getting his dream date with Joanna. The inconsequential plot is secondary to the affectionate characterisation of the Western suburbs community in which Danny lives. The excellent cast also includes Steve Bisley.

results.title: Cromwell
results.creator_credit: Ken Hughes, Irving Allen and Columbia
results.brief_description: The last flourish of the decadent Cavaliers, the obdurate zeal of the insurgent Puritans, the mighty clashes in Parliament and on the battlefields, the king’s death on the headsman’s block - a crucial phase of British history is encompassed in “Cromewell”. This powerful story unfolds majestically against a backdrop of pageant, bloody battle and the agonies of a country torn by civil war. Stars Alec Guinness as Charles I and Richard Harris as Oliver Cromwell with a distinguished supporting cast.

results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tourneur, Val Lewton and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: This classic horror tale stars Simone Simon as a young bride who is the victim of an ancient curse, that affects the female descendants of a Serbian village, transforming her into a panther to attack victims before reverting to human form. Also starring Kent Smith. Based on the story by DeWitt Bodeen.

results.title: Apocalypse now
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola and Omni Zoetrope
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s stunning vision of man’s heart of darkness, revealed through the particular madness of the Vietnam War. Lieutenant Willard (Martin Sheen) receives orders to seek out the renegade Colonel Kurtz (Marlon Brando) who has disappeared into the depths of the jungle. Willard’s mission becomes an epic journey into his own soul and that of the mysterious Kurtz. Based on the novella by Joseph Conrad, “Heart of Darkness”. Original music by Carmine Coppola, Francis Ford Coppola, Mickey Hart.

results.title: My left foot: the story of Christy Brown
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Noel Pearson and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the autobiography of Christy Brown, this is the extraordinary true story of the Irish writer who overcomes the limitations imposed by cerebral palsy to live a life of zest, love and passion. Using his left foot, Christy channelled his words and images into best-selling novels, a true triumph against the odds. Daniel Day Lewis won an Academy Award for his performance as Christy Brown.

results.title: The Conversation
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Paramount Pictures and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays Harry Caul, an expert surveillance man, who during a routine wire-tapping job hears snatches of conversation which make him believe a young couple is in danger. The more Harry tries to discover the secret surrounding the couple, the more he descends into a nightmare of secrecy, betrayal and murder, all taking place amidst a world of moral ambivalence. Influenced by the Watergate scandals of the early 1970’s, “The Conversation” is a tense and excellently edited suspense thriller. It is also Coppola’s most anguished and personal film.

results.title: Jewel of the Nile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Lewis Teague, Michael Douglas and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Thrill-packed sequel to “Romancing the Stone”. It’s been six months since Joan Wilder (Kathleen Turner) and Jack Colton (Michael Douglas) sailed into the sunset after their first adventure - but it hasn’t all been smooth sailing. Then they learn of the mysterious, priceless Jewel of the Nile, and it’s non-stop excitement as they race to beat villainous Danny de Vito to the treasure.

results.title: Three fugitives (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Lauren Shuler and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Nolte plays a tough ex-con, fresh out of prison, who is trapped in a bank and held hostage by a bungling, first-time holdup man (Martin Short). No one will believe Nolte’s innocence and no one can believe Short’s guilt, so the unlikely duo become partners in crime - and parenting, when Short’s six year old daughter joins the fugitives on a wheel-screeching run for the Canadian border. An American version of the successful French film of the same name.
